title: Fairly heavy showers expected in parts of the island
byline: The Meteorology Department says that showers or thundershowers will occur in several places in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, Southern, and Uva provinces and in the Nuwara Eliya district after 2:00 p.m.

title: Two including Constable arrested for helping ex-IGP Deshabandu to hide
byline: A Police Constable attached to the Special Protection Division and another individual from Thalawathugoda have been arrested for allegedly assisting suspended IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon in hiding from February 27 to March 19, according to the Police Spokesman.

title: ‘Wild Cookbook’ hits 10M subscribers, making Sri Lankan YouTube history
byline: Renowned Sri Lankan chef and YouTube content creator Charith N. Silva has achieved a historic milestone, with his YouTube channel, Wild Cookbook, becoming the first Sri Lankan channel to surpass 10 million subscribers.

title: Israel strikes Beirut for first time since ceasefire with Hezbollah
byline: Israel launched an attack on the Lebanese capital Beirut on Friday for the first time since a ceasefire ended fighting between Israeli forces and the Hezbollah militant group in November.

title: India, Sri Lanka set to ink major defence pact next week
byline: For the first time, India and Sri Lanka are set to sign an ambitious defence cooperation pact during Prime Minister Narendra Modi’s visit to Colombo next week, in a significant move that comes nearly four decades after the IPKF’s intervention in the island nation.

title: Elon Musk sells X to his own xAI for $33 billion in all-stock deal
byline: Elon Musk has sold social media site X to his own xAI artificial intelligence company in a $33 billion all-stock deal, the billionaire announced on Friday.

title: At least 694 dead, 1,670 injured after powerful earthquake in Myanmar
byline: A powerful earthquake rocked Myanmar on Friday, March 28, causing extensive damage across a wide swath of one of the world’s poorest countries and prompting officials to warn that the initial death toll was updated to 694 dead, 1,670 injured, according to the junta on Saturday.

title: Myanmar’s earthquake death toll jumps to over 1,000 as more bodies recovered from rubble
byline: The death toll from a powerful 7.7 magnitude earthquake in Myanmar jumped to more than 1,000 on Saturday as more bodies were pulled from the rubble of the scores of buildings that collapsed when it struck near the country’s second-largest city.

title: Youth arrested for distributing child pornography via social media
byline: A suspect allegedly involved in the distribution of child pornography using social media has been arrested by the Bureau for the Prevention of Abuse of Children and Women.

title: Sri Lanka’s Ransilu Jayathilake wins Gold at Asia Pacific Powerlifting Championships
byline: Sri Lankan powerlifter Ransilu Jayathilake has secured the gold medal in the 120 kg weight class at the 2025 Asia Pacific Powerlifting Championships held in Australia.

title: Person arrested for aiding and abetting ex-IGP Deshabandu granted bail
byline: The individual who was arrested today on suspicion of aiding and abetting the concealment of suspended IGP Deshabandu Tennakoon has been ordered to be released on bail.
